messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kim running about with scissors
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/10/00 10:24:47 PM Central Daylight Time, libbygirl@xtra.co.NZ writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/10/00 10:24:47 PM Central Daylight Time,
libbygirl@... writes:

<< "Make sure you have clean undies on in case
you are hit by a car" Apparently that is standard triage procedure - Check
her blood pressure, vital stats and undies... >>

I actually WAS in a car wreck this past fall. When we got to the hospital I
was in AGONIES of embarrassment because -I'm still blushing-I wasn't wearing
any! LOL I was 30 weeks pregnant and was just too big for regular undies (I
couldn't even wear them UNDER my belly) and hadn't gotten to the store for
maternity undies. Yikes. Although, to be truthful, my regular undies are
normally so tatty that going au naturel isn't that much more embarrassing. I
guess it's a sign of middle age and complacency - I don't buy those slinky
matching bras and panties anymore. (I HATE those ridiculous Victoria's
Secret commercials) And yes, now that I'm not pregnant I DO wear underwear!


*** KiM ***
runs with scissors
